EventCache Class

Defined in: src\eventcache.js:203

The Event Cache class is a compilation of static functions with isolated data structures.

  • Methods
  • Properties

Creates an event listener and adds its signature to the associated cache.

    • The object.
  • event String
    • The event name.

(
  • args
)
Array private static

Defined in src\eventcache.js:12

Validates the arguments and tries to extract an event signature.

Parameters:

  • args Object
    • The original arguments array from a call to add or remove.

Returns:

Array:

The event signature.

flush

(
  • [cache]
)
static

Defined in src\eventcache.js:138

Removes all event signatures from the given cache and releases the respective event listeners. Calling flush without specifying a cache will unbind and remove all listeners in all caches. Empty caches will then be dropped and can no longer be used. Only the default cache will remain.

Parameters:

  • [cache] Number optional
    • The index of the cache to flush. If not provided, all caches will be flushed.

status

() Object static

Defined in src\eventcache.js:184

Provides insight into the internals.

Returns:

Object:

The default cache and all additional caches.
